sentence.Network_en: Nerve cells have limited ability to regenerate if destroyed.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果受到损伤，神经细胞再造的能力有限。

sentence.Network_cn: 他们最终决定通过住房合作社来重建奥米斯顿月牙街。

sentence.Network_en: The govern-ment will continue to try to regenerate inner city areas.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府将继续努力重建内城地区。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adjective): from Latin regeneratus 'created again', past participle of regenerare, from re- 'again' + generare 'create'. The verb dates from the mid 16th cent

entry.def: To regenerate something means to develop and improve it to make it more active, successful, or important, especially after a period when it has been getting worse.

example.ex: The government will continue to try to regenerate inner city areas.
example.tran: 政府将继续努力重建内城地区。

entry.tran: (使）(器官或肌体组织）再生；(使）再造
entry.def: If organs or tissues regenerate or if something regenerates them, they heal and grow again after they have been damaged.

example.ex: Nerve cells have limited ability to regenerate if destroyed...
example.tran: 如果受到损伤，神经细胞再造的能力有限。

means.word_mean: 1. re-establish on a new, usually improved, basis or make new or like new;

sentences.sentence: "We renewed our friendship after a hiatus of twenty years"

means.word_mean: 2. amplify (an electron current) by causing part of the power in the output circuit to act upon the input circuit
3. bring, lead, or force to abandon a wrong or evil course of life, conduct, and adopt a right one;
4. return to life; get or give new life or energy;

sentences.sentence: "The week at the spa restored me"

means.word_mean: 5. replace (tissue or a body part) through the formation of new tissue;

sentences.sentence: "regenerate by redemption from error or decay"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"人或地位等"; 2. 表形容词,"具有……的"; 3. 表动词,"做,造成;使"

stems_affixes.word_buile: celib不结婚+ate人或地位等→n.独身者;adj.不结婚的;禁欲的
grade等级+uate=ate人或地位等→一级一级走完学业→毕业
col共同+legi读+ate具有……的→共同读书→学院的
consider考虑+ate具有……的→考虑到的
ef出现+femin女人+ate具有……的→出现女人状态
in进+ate具有……的→innate与出生一起进来→天赋的
in进入+veter老+ate具有……的→使成为老的

sentences.en: This creature’s tail will regenerate if it is cut off.
sentences.cn: 这种动物的尾巴如果被割掉,会再生出来。
